item.title: Someone has dumped a large amount of rubbish, 19th September
item.description:
It seems just next to the shops someone has driven down the side and dumped rubbish in the tree line just where the fence is.

item.title: Flag on Lampost opposite Elmer’s End roundabout, 19th September
item.description:
There are two Union Jack flags that have been illegally put up on a lamp post outside Elmers end roundabout. Under the highway act 1980 it is illegal to attach anything to public infrastructure as such I would urge you to take action and immediately remove the flags in accordance with the law.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Skip in the road, 19th September
item.description:
There is a an over flowing skip in the road near 35 the drive. It has no lights or reflectors and recently contributed to a serious car accident on the road. I’m not sure if it’s licensed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London

item.title: Corner full of pink rubbish bags, 19th September
item.description:
Many days, again and again.....can you take this concern with rubbish on Walwort road and Camberwell road serious ?! Can bin waste car go throw along this 2 roads , from Camberwell to Elephant and pick up every all waste on street from both side. Is this so problem ?????

item.title: Tree leaning into pavement, 19th September
item.description:
As per picture, the tree is leaning into the pavement causing a hazard at head height for those who are visually impaired. As the pavement is narrow in this area due to the planter the tree sits in for anyone with a visual impairment this creates a hazard and puts them at risk of injuring their head. I am aware of this happening and injuring someone when they were mobilising along the pavement. I would advise that this is looked at and the tree potentially removed to minimise any risk of injury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunbar Avenue, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti and dirt on bike storages, 19th September
item.description:
There are 2 bike stores installed on Victory Place opposite my windows. One older and one more recently. Both have now graffiti on all over them and they are also very dirty. It seems once the council installs them they get never washed. They only bring the general tone of the area down. And it is something directly opposite my windows that I have no option but to see every day. It was much better before they were installed as there was no canvas for graffiti and to collect dirt. I hope it is possible for the council to address both, the graffiti and dirt on these bike stores as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victory Place, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged surface, 19th September
item.description:
The on street parking bay outside number 96 Bladindon Drive and surrounding non slab area is damaged. The surface is loose and uneven with a couple of dips. This has been like it for months if not years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Bladindon Drive, Blendon, London
